intro: Lappula tianschanica, commonly known as the Tian Shan lappula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pale yellow or greenish in color. Lappula tianschanica is often found in meadows and on slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
